{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3359805,"name":"","username":"ALTAN75","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9de0a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T06:59:39.799Z","cooked":"

Hi, We are planning to buy swerve driv for the next season but we don’t know which ratio to choose L1,L2 or L3?
(because of our budget we can only get neo motors)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T06:59:39.799Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":404,"reads":515,"readers_count":514,"score":2118.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65892,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3359811,"name":"Brandon McDonald","username":"brandonmcd","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T08:26:18.682Z","cooked":"

The choice between ratios for your swerve drive largely depends on your team’s needs for speed versus torque. If your priority is faster movement, go for a higher ratio like L3. if you need higher torque to prevent being pushed around by other robots, a lower ratio like L1 would be advisable.

If you want some insight on what swerve module to chose check out this thread to see a variety of options.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T08:27:31.641Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":495,"readers_count":494,"score":189.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"Brandon McDonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/what-swerve-do-you-prefer/461393","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"What swerve do you prefer?","clicks":104}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FAMNM President"},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/2","custom_user_title":"FAMNM President","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359828,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T11:21:27.191Z","cooked":"

How fast do you anticipate driving and what do you think your drivers can handle? If you think that they will not be driving extremely fast, then maybe chose a lower ratio so that the motors can run at higher efficiency.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T11:21:27.191Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":437,"readers_count":436,"score":117.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/3","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359831,"name":"Ty Galle","username":"Ty3618","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ty3618/{size}/256568_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T11:36:41.766Z","cooked":"

My team decided to go with a high speed, low torque gear ratio. I believe we did some math and realized that we had enough torque headroom in the case a robot was driving directly into us. I’m not an expert in swerve, but I would recommend getting L3 based on my team’s own decision.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T11:36:41.766Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"Ty Galle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Petoskey Paladins Scout"},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/4","custom_user_title":"Petoskey Paladins Scout","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359836,"name":"hrench","username":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T11:49:38.017Z","cooked":"

the need for higher torque coincides with whether your robot is the full maximum weight. If you can build a ninety-pound robot and use the higher ratios, you’ll be the fastest robot at the dance—and people will notice.

if you’re not comfortable making your mechanisms lightweight, you’ll need more torque to move. a 125 lb robot is still okay, but not as fun. Also, lightweight often coincides with smaller dimensions. If you want a big robot, it will likely be heavier.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T11:52:17.869Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":95.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"hrench","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17877,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Bob Hrenchir, mechanical build mentor, team 1108, Paola, KS"},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/5","custom_user_title":"Bob Hrenchir, mechanical build mentor, team 1108, Paola, KS","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359866,"name":"","username":"KfirNeuman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T12:47:24.047Z","cooked":"

To see this in action I would recommend looking at orbit 1690’s robot this year. It is incredibly small and light and flies across the field.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T12:47:24.047Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":280,"readers_count":279,"score":96.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":17877,"username":"hrench","name":"hrench","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hrench/{size}/5972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62573,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3075 Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/6","custom_user_title":"3075 Code Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3359926,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T13:37:45.280Z","cooked":"

Yes.

You might also have a look at 6081.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T13:37:45.280Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":246,"readers_count":245,"score":69.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62573,"username":"KfirNeuman","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/7","custom_user_title":"I live for the details.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360290,"name":"Andy Mundell","username":"suPURDUEperAndy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/supurdueperandy/{size}/266209_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T19:48:27.417Z","cooked":"

I feel like if you are asking this question, the answer is likely L2, especially without knowing next years game yet. Its the middle option for a reason.

I wouldnt venture into L3 unless you feel prepared to design lighter robots or take other measures to mitigate brownout. You can always order an upgrade kit later.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T19:48:27.417Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":78.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462402,"topic_slug":"which-swerve-ratio-to-choose","display_username":"Andy Mundell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36711,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/which-swerve-ratio-to-choose/462402/8","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360299,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T20:03:39.891Z","cooked":"

L1 is almost never advisable as it is traction limited so you will get about the same pushing power as L2 but without the extra speed.

suPURDUEperAndy:

I feel like if you are asking this question, the answer is likely L2, especially without knowing next years game yet. Its the middle option for a reason.

For most non-full field sprints for max weight robots, L2 tends to be closer to optimal than L3 because acceleration matters a lot. L2 also still is really fast when driven well. You can additionally buy the 16t pinion kit if you want faster speeds (L2 16t pinion has a ratio of 5.91:1 compared to L3’s 6.12:1) while still keeping the option of running L2.
